defaultRecipes.description: A family recipe passed down to generations that is affordable to make! I was able to get the ingredients relatively cheap at The Market near student housing. Foodland at Ala Moana is also a great alternative to search for ingredients.
steps: Boil lightly salted water then proceed to cook elbow macaroni until cooked.  Afterwards, proceed to drain.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat, then stir in flour and salt for 5 minutes.  Then pour in milk while stirring until it is smooth and bubbling. Next, add cheddar cheese and continue to stir until cheese is melted
Fold macaroni into cheese sauce until it is coated.

defaultRecipes.description: A healthy meal that is full of flavor, protein and fiber!
steps: Dice onion and mince the garlic, then cook both in a large pot with olive oil with medium heat for 1-2 minutes.  Next add ground beef and cook until it is browned.
Add flour and the chili powder to the pot and coat the meat.  Continue to stir for 1-2 minutes.
Drain and rinse the black and kidney beans.  Then add them along with the tomato sauce, and kernels to the pot.  Continue to stir after adding in the items.
Add macaroni and beef broth then proceed to stir.
Place lid on top of pot and turn the heat to high to allow pot to boil.  After boiling, stir to loosen any pasta.
Allow the pot to simmer on medium-low for 15 minutes.
Once cooked, turn heat off and stir in additional cheese until melted.
Serve and enjoy while it's still hot!

defaultRecipes.description: A very nutritious smoothie for breakfast
steps: First, add milk into the blender. The amount of how much want to drink is up to you!
Next, add spinach but make sure not to add too much.
Finally, add your frozen fruits.  If you want you can additional toppings such as other fruits!
Transfer contents into cups and enjoy!
